DOC.brief_summary: The investigator evaluate whether primary implantation self-expanding nitinol stent yield anatomical clinical benefit superior afford percutaneous transluminal angioplasty optional secondary stenting .
DOC.brief_title: PTA vs. Primary Stenting SFA Using Self-Expandable Nitinol Stents
DOC.criteria: symptomatic peripheral artery disease severe intermittent claudication ( Fontaine stage IIb ) critical limb ischemia patient stenosis occlusion originate SFA 25 cm length stenosis/occlusion previous bypass surgery site treatment history intolerance antiplatelet therapy adverse reaction heparin bleed diathesis creatinine > 2.5 mg/dL active bacterial infection allergy contrast medium previous stent placement immediately adjacent target lesion
